pros:
Work Life Balance
The people are really great
Creative freedom (a lot of freedom to take chances for success)
cons: Health benefits for your dependents get really expensive.
Quite a few at this time.
advice_to_mgmt: Stop power tripping and pointing fingers at all the other departments and just worry about your own.

pros: Fun atmosphere sometimes, lots of company events. There are some really great and talented people here. Great views in the office. They have some big possible potential
cons: Poor communication between teams, sometimes causing toxic environments. Little room for much personal growth

pros: The hours were good, pretty atmosphere, "fun" company/department events and health insurance was decent.
cons: On a weekly basis the customer service department was verbally assaulted by customers that were angry and frustrated with the company's poor return policy. Each department was cliquish to the point that no one communicated to each other, thus creating a toxic environment.

pros: similar age employees, generally nice people to work with, location, flexible hours (create your own schedule). owners are approachable.
cons: tedious, boring, counted the time until i was out, no room for growth, never wanted to hire warehouse employees as FT- kept as contract so they didnt have to pay benefits
advice_to_mgmt: value your temp staff. if after a few months, you like them enough to renew a contract, please offer FT work. less of a revolving door and need for employees to retrain new hires.

pros: The company is small and your individual contribution makes big impact. CEO knows each employee personally and have open door policy. A lot of work and not whole a lot of politics.
cons: Health benefits and 401K plan could be better. Could employ more relaxed working from home policy, No paid parking.
